originalTitle: Nigeria police confirm mass church abductions after previous denial
title: Nigeria police confirm mass church abductions after previous denial
content: More than 160 people were reportedly taken from three churches in the northern Kaduna state.

originalTitle: Detained veteran Ugandan opposition figure critically ill in hospital, his party says
title: Detained veteran Ugandan opposition figure critically ill in hospital, his party says
content: Kizza Besigye’s party says his condition is critical, but authorities say he was taken to hospital for a routine check-up.

title: Ex-president accused of murder plot expelled from Togo to Burkina Faso
content: Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba has not commented on the accusations from Burkina Faso.

content: Follow our live build-up with full team news coverage before our text commentary stream of the league phase match.

title: Canada detains Israeli ex-soldier and comedian over Gaza complaint
content: Israeli comedian and former soldier Guy Hochman was detained in Toronto after complaints over his conduct in Gaza.

title: Who was Rifaat al-Assad, commander of Syria’s 1982 Hama massacre?
content: The ‘Butcher of Hama’ and former Syrian vice president dies in exile at age 89.

title: Israeli strike in Gaza kills three journalists, first responders say
content: Another eight Palestinians were killed by Israeli artillery and gunfire across Gaza on Wednesday, according to medics.

originalTitle: US to transfer Islamic State prisoners from Syria to Iraq
title: US to transfer Islamic State prisoners from Syria to Iraq
content: The move comes as Syrian government forces take control of north-eastern areas where Kurdish-led forces have long controlled.

originalTitle: Seven more countries agree to join Trump's Board of Peace
title: Seven more countries agree to join Trump's Board of Peace
content: Seven Muslim-majority countries publicly accept an invitation to Trump's new organisation, joining Albania, Bahran, Hungary, Morocco and Israel.

originalTitle: Palace striker Mateta tells club he wants to leave
title: Palace striker Mateta tells club he wants to leave
content: France striker Jean-Philippe Mateta has 18 months remaining on his current deal at Selhurst Park and as things stand he will not be signing an extension.

originalTitle: Women's Club World Cup schedule could be 'catastrophic' for WSL
title: Women's Club World Cup schedule could be 'catastrophic' for WSL
content: English players and officials are shocked by the current scheduling for the inaugural Women's Club World Cup because of the impact it could have on the WSL.

originalTitle: Spurs, Arsenal or Newcastle - which teams have had most injuries?
title: Football Fun and Ouchies! Which Teams Had Many Boo-Boos?
content:
Hello, Football Fans!

Jambo, amazing friends! It's your friendly news reporter, bringing you exciting stories from our beautiful continent, Africa! Today, we have some special news for all you football lovers out there. We are going to talk about big football teams and their players. You know how sometimes when you run fast or play outside, you might trip and get a little scrape on your knee? Or maybe you twist your ankle a tiny bit? Those are like little "ouchies." In football, when grown-up players get hurt, we call them "injuries." It means a part of their body needs a little rest to get better. Football players run super-duper fast! They jump high and kick the ball with all their strength. Sometimes, they might accidentally bump into another player. Or they might land funny after a jump. This can make them get an ouchie. It's just part of playing a very active game.

What is the Premier League?

The Premier League is a very big football competition. It's like the biggest football tournament where many famous teams play against each other every week. They play to see who is the best team! These teams are from a faraway country called England. But many people all over the world, including here in Africa, love watching them play! **Did you know?** Football is the most popular sport in the whole world! Lots of children and grown-ups love to kick a ball around.

The Three Teams and Their Boo-Boos!

We are going to look at three special teams. Their names are Spurs, Arsenal, and Newcastle. They are all big teams in the Premier League. We want to find out which of these teams had players with the most ouchies this season. It's like seeing who needed the most plasters! First, let's talk about a team called Spurs. The news says that Spurs had *many* players get ouchies this year. Oh dear! Imagine if your whole football team had lots of friends who couldn't play because their legs hurt, or their arms needed a rest. That makes it very hard for the team to win games. When a player gets an ouchie, they cannot play football for a little while. They need to see a special doctor who helps athletes. This doctor helps them get better and stronger. Sometimes, they need to rest for a few days, or even a few weeks. It's very important to let their bodies heal. **Did you know?** Players wear special pads called shin guards on their legs! This helps protect their shins (the front part of your lower leg) from getting hurt when they kick the ball or bump into other players. It's like having a superhero shield for your legs! Next up is a team called Arsenal. They also had some players with ouchies, but maybe not as many as Spurs. When a team has fewer players with boo-boos, it means more of their strong players can play together. This helps them try their very best to score goals and win! Football is all about teamwork. Imagine if your best friend, who is a super striker, suddenly can't play! It makes the team sad. So, when players are healthy, the whole team is happy and strong.

Newcastle and More About Getting Better

And finally, there's the team called Newcastle. They also had players with ouchies. It looks like many teams in the Premier League had players who needed a little break to get better. It shows how tough and fast the game of football can be! When players get an ouchie, they don't just sit around. They do special exercises with their doctors or therapists. These exercises help make their muscles strong again. It's like learning to walk or run again after a big fall. They work very hard to get back on the field! **Did you know?** Eating healthy food like fruits, vegetables, and strong protein helps your body stay strong and heal faster! It’s like giving your body superhero fuel!

Why Are Ouchies Important News?

You might ask, "Why is it important to know about players' ouchies?" Well, if many players on a team are hurt, the coach has a big problem. The coach needs good players to play the game. If the best players are resting, the team might not play as well. It's harder to win matches when your top players are on the bench! It's also important for the players themselves. Nobody wants to be hurt! Players want to be on the field, playing the game they love. When they are hurt, they miss playing with their friends and scoring goals. So, getting better quickly is very important for them.

How Can We Stay Safe When Playing?

Now, you might be thinking about your own football games! How can *you* stay safe and avoid ouchies? 1. **Warm-up:** Before you start running super fast, do some gentle stretches. Wiggle your arms and legs. This wakes up your muscles! 2. **Wear good shoes:** Make sure your shoes fit well and have good grip. 3. **Listen to grown-ups:** Your coach or parents know what's best. Listen to their safety tips. 4. **Play fairly:** Don't push or trip your friends. Play kindly! 5. **Rest:** If you feel tired or have a little ouchie, tell a grown-up and take a rest. Your body needs it! **Did you know?** Resting is just as important as playing! When you rest, your body gets stronger and repairs itself. That's why we sleep a lot!

Wishing All Players Well!

So, it looks like Spurs had a tough time with many players needing to rest. Arsenal and Newcastle also had their share of ouchies. We hope all the players get better very, very soon and can play their best football again! We also hope all of you stay safe and happy when you play your favourite sports! Keep playing, keep smiling, and remember to look after your wonderful bodies! That's all for today from your friendly reporter! Keep shining, everyone!
summary: This news tells us about big football teams like Spurs, Arsenal, and Newcastle, and which ones had players with the most "ouchies" or injuries this season.
whyMatters: It is important because when many players are hurt, it makes it hard for the team to play well and win games. We also learn how players get better and how we can stay safe when we play!
